context: The top ten best-selling drugs of 2013 totaled <a0_0><b5_0>$75.6 billion<b5_0/><a0_0/> in sales, with the anti-inflammatory drug <a1_0><b6_0>Humira<b6_0/><a1_0/> being the best-selling drug worldwide at $10.7 billion in sales. The second and third best selling were Enbrel and Remicade, respectively. The top three best-selling drugs in the United States in 2013 were Abilify ($6.3 billion,) Nexium ($6 billion) and Humira ($5.4 billion). The best-selling drug ever, <a2_0><b7_0>Lipitor<b7_0/><a2_0/>, averaged $13 billion annually and netted <a3_0><b8_0>$141 billion<b8_0/><a3_0/> total over its lifetime before Pfizer's patent expired in November <a4_0><b9_0>2011<b9_0/><a4_0/>.
